text: Vincent Thomas Lombardi (June 11, 1913, in Brooklyn, New York, USA â€” September 3, 1970) was an American football coach that never had a losing season. Lombardi was named NFL Man of the Decade in the 1960s, and won five NFL championships, including winning the first two Super Bowls. The yearly trophy given to the Super Bowl champion was renamed the Vince Lombardi Trophy (right) in 1971, the same year Lombardi was named to the Pro Football Hall of Fame. He was head coach of the Green Bay Packers and the Washington Redskins. == Other websites == *Official Vince Lombardi website *Vince Lombardi information from the Pro Football Hall of Fame website Category:National Football League coaches Category:Sportspeople from New York City Category:1913 births Category:1970 deaths
title: Vince Lombardi
